And<S>1161</S> after<S>3326</S> five<S>4002</S> days<S>2250</S> Ananias<S>367</S> the high priest<S>749</S> descended<S>2597</S> with<S>3326</S> the elders<S>4245</S>, and<S>2532</S> with a certain<S>5100</S> orator<S>4489</S> named Tertullus<S>5061</S>, who<S>3748</S> informed<S>1718</S> the governor<S>2232</S> against<S>2596</S> Paul<S>3972</S>.
And<S>1161</S> when he<S>846</S> was called forth<S>2564</S>, Tertullus<S>5061</S> began<S>756</S> to accuse<S>2723</S> him, saying<S>3004</S>, Seeing that by<S>1223</S> thee<S>4675</S> we enjoy<S>5177</S> great<S>4183</S> quietness<S>1515</S>, and<S>2532</S> that very worthy deeds<S>2735</S> are done<S>1096</S> unto this<S>5129</S> nation<S>1484</S> by<S>1223</S> thy<S>4674</S> providence<S>4307</S>,
<S>5037</S> We accept<S>588</S> it always<S>3839</S>, and<S>2532</S> in all places<S>3837</S>, most noble<S>2903</S> Felix<S>5344</S>, with<S>3326</S> all<S>3956</S> thankfulness<S>2169</S>.
Notwithstanding<S>1161</S>, that<S>3363</S> I be<S>4119</S> not<S>3363</S> <S>1909</S> further<S>4119</S> tedious<S>1465</S> unto thee<S>4571</S>, I pray<S>3870</S> thee<S>4571</S> that thou wouldest hear<S>191</S> us<S>2257</S> of thy<S>4674</S> clemency<S>1932</S> a few words<S>4935</S>.
For<S>1063</S> we have found<S>2147</S> this<S>5126</S> man<S>435</S> a pestilent<S>3061</S> fellow, and<S>2532</S> a mover<S>2795</S> of sedition<S>4714</S> among all<S>3956</S> the Jews<S>2453</S> throughout<S>2596</S> the world<S>3625</S>, and<S>5037</S> a ringleader<S>4414</S> of the sect<S>139</S> of the Nazarenes<S>3480</S>:
Who<S>3739</S> also<S>2532</S> hath gone about<S>3985</S> to profane<S>953</S> the temple<S>2411</S>:<S>2532</S> whom<S>3739</S> we took<S>2902</S>, and<S>2532</S> would<S>2309</S> have judged<S>2919</S> according<S>2596</S> to our<S>2251</S> law<S>3551</S>.
But<S>1161</S> the chief captain<S>5506</S> Lysias<S>3079</S> came<S>3928</S> upon us, and with<S>3326</S> great<S>4183</S> violence<S>970</S> took him away<S>520</S> out of<S>1537</S> our<S>2257</S> hands<S>5495</S>,
Commanding<S>2753</S> his<S>846</S> accusers<S>2725</S> to come<S>2064</S> unto<S>1909</S> thee<S>4571</S>: by examining<S>350</S> of<S>3844</S> whom<S>3739</S> thyself<S>846</S> mayest<S>1410</S> take knowledge<S>1921</S> of<S>4012</S> all<S>3956</S> these things<S>5130</S>, whereof<S>3739</S> we<S>2249</S> accuse<S>2723</S> him<S>846</S>.
And<S>1161</S> the Jews<S>2453</S> also<S>2532</S> assented<S>4934</S>, saying<S>5335</S> that these things<S>5023</S> were<S>2192</S> so<S>3779</S>.
Then<S>1161</S> Paul<S>3972</S>, after that the governor<S>2232</S> had beckoned<S>3506</S> unto him<S>846</S> to speak<S>3004</S>, answered<S>611</S>, Forasmuch as I know<S>1987</S> that thou<S>4571</S> hast been<S>5607</S> of<S>1537</S> many<S>4183</S> years<S>2094</S> a judge<S>2923</S> unto this<S>5129</S> nation<S>1484</S>, I do<S>626</S> the more cheerfully<S>2115</S> answer<S>626</S> for<S>4012</S> myself<S>1683</S>:
Because that thou<S>4675</S> mayest<S>1410</S> understand<S>1097</S>, that<S>3754</S> there are<S>1526</S> yet but<S>2228</S> <S>3756</S> twelve<S>1177</S> days<S>2250</S> <S>4119</S> since<S>575</S> <S>3739</S> I<S>3427</S> went up<S>305</S> to<S>1722</S> Jerusalem<S>2419</S> for to worship<S>4352</S>.
And<S>2532</S> they neither<S>3777</S> found<S>2147</S> me<S>3165</S> in<S>1722</S> the temple<S>2411</S> disputing<S>1256</S> with<S>4314</S> any man<S>5100</S>, neither<S>2228</S> raising up<S>1999</S> <S>4160</S> the people<S>3793</S> <S>1999</S>, neither<S>3777</S> in<S>1722</S> the synagogues<S>4864</S>, nor<S>3777</S> in<S>2596</S> the city<S>4172</S>:
Neither<S>3777</S> can<S>1410</S> they prove<S>3936</S> <S>3165</S> the things<S>4012</S> whereof<S>3739</S> they<S>2723</S> now<S>3568</S> accuse<S>2723</S> me<S>3450</S>.
But<S>1161</S> this<S>5124</S> I confess<S>3670</S> unto thee<S>4671</S>, that<S>3754</S> after<S>2596</S> the way<S>3598</S> which<S>3739</S> they call<S>3004</S> heresy<S>139</S>, so<S>3779</S> worship I<S>3000</S> the God<S>2316</S> of my fathers<S>3971</S>, believing<S>4100</S> all things<S>3956</S> which<S>3588</S> are written<S>1125</S> in<S>2596</S> the law<S>3551</S> and<S>2532</S> in<S>1722</S> the prophets<S>4396</S>:
And have<S>2192</S> hope<S>1680</S> toward<S>1519</S> God<S>2316</S>, which<S>3739</S> they<S>3778</S> themselves<S>846</S> also<S>2532</S> allow<S>4327</S>, that there shall be<S>3195</S> <S>1510</S> a resurrection<S>386</S> of the dead<S>3498</S>, both<S>5037</S> of the just<S>1342</S> and<S>2532</S> unjust<S>94</S>.
And<S>1161</S> herein<S>1722</S> <S>5129</S> do I exercise<S>778</S> myself<S>846</S>, to have<S>2192</S> always<S>1275</S> a conscience<S>4893</S> void of offence<S>677</S> toward<S>4314</S> God<S>2316</S>, and<S>2532</S> toward men<S>444</S>.
Now<S>1161</S> after<S>1223</S> many<S>4119</S> years<S>2094</S> I came<S>3854</S> to bring<S>4160</S> alms<S>1654</S> to<S>1519</S> my<S>3450</S> nation<S>1484</S>, and<S>2532</S> offerings<S>4376</S>.
<S>1161</S> Whereupon<S>1722</S> <S>3739</S> certain<S>5100</S> Jews<S>2453</S> from<S>575</S> Asia<S>773</S> found<S>2147</S> me<S>3165</S> purified<S>48</S> in<S>1722</S> the temple<S>2411</S>, neither<S>3756</S> with<S>3326</S> multitude<S>3793</S>, nor<S>3761</S> with<S>3326</S> tumult<S>2351</S>.
Who<S>3739</S> ought<S>1163</S> <S>1163</S> to have been here<S>3918</S> before<S>1909</S> thee<S>4675</S>, and<S>2532</S> object<S>2723</S>, if<S>1536</S> they had<S>2192</S> ought<S>1536</S> against<S>4314</S> me<S>3165</S>.
Or else<S>2228</S> let<S>2036</S> these<S>846</S> same<S>3778</S> here say<S>2036</S>, if<S>1536</S> they have found<S>2147</S> any<S>1536</S> evil doing<S>92</S> in<S>1722</S> me<S>1698</S>, while I<S>3450</S> stood<S>2476</S> before<S>1909</S> the council<S>4892</S>,
Except<S>2228</S> it be for<S>4012</S> this<S>5026</S> one<S>3391</S> voice<S>5456</S>, that<S>3739</S> I cried<S>2896</S> standing<S>2476</S> among<S>1722</S> them<S>846</S>, Touching<S>3754</S> <S>4012</S> the resurrection<S>386</S> of the dead<S>3498</S> I<S>1473</S> am called in question<S>2919</S> by<S>5259</S> you<S>5216</S> this day<S>4594</S>.
And<S>1161</S> when Felix<S>5344</S> heard<S>191</S> these things<S>5023</S>, having more perfect<S>197</S> knowledge<S>1492</S> of<S>4012</S> that way<S>3598</S>, he deferred<S>306</S> them<S>846</S>, and said<S>2036</S>, When<S>3752</S> Lysias<S>3079</S> the chief captain<S>5506</S> shall come down<S>2597</S>, I will know the uttermost<S>1231</S> of your<S>5209</S> matter<S>2596</S>.
And<S>5037</S> he commanded<S>1299</S> a centurion<S>1543</S> to keep<S>5083</S> Paul<S>3972</S>, and<S>5037</S> to let him have<S>2192</S> liberty<S>425</S>, and<S>2532</S> that he should forbid<S>2967</S> none<S>3367</S> of his<S>846</S> acquaintance<S>2398</S> to minister<S>5256</S> or<S>2228</S> come<S>4334</S> unto him<S>846</S>.
And<S>1161</S> after<S>3326</S> certain<S>5100</S> days<S>2250</S>, when Felix<S>5344</S> came<S>3854</S> with<S>4862</S> his<S>846</S> wife<S>1135</S> Drusilla<S>1409</S>, which was<S>5607</S> a Jewess<S>2453</S>, he sent for<S>3343</S> Paul<S>3972</S>, and<S>2532</S> heard<S>191</S> him<S>846</S> concerning<S>4012</S> the faith<S>4102</S> in<S>1519</S> Christ<S>5547</S>.
And<S>1161</S> as he<S>846</S> reasoned<S>1256</S> of<S>4012</S> righteousness<S>1343</S>, temperance<S>2532</S> <S>1466</S>, and<S>2532</S> judgment<S>2917</S> to come<S>3195</S> <S>1510</S>, Felix<S>5344</S> trembled<S>1096</S> <S>1719</S>, and answered<S>611</S>, Go thy way<S>4198</S> for this time<S>3568</S>; when<S>1161</S> I have<S>2192</S> <S>3335</S> a convenient season<S>2540</S>, I will call for<S>3333</S> thee<S>4571</S>.
He hoped<S>1679</S> also<S>260</S> <S>1161</S> <S>2532</S> that<S>3754</S> money<S>5536</S> should have been given<S>1325</S> him<S>846</S> of<S>5259</S> Paul<S>3972</S>, that<S>3704</S> he might loose<S>3089</S> him<S>846</S>: wherefore<S>1352</S> he sent for<S>3343</S> him<S>846</S> the oftener<S>4437</S>, and<S>2532</S> communed with<S>3656</S> him<S>846</S>.
But<S>1161</S> after<S>4137</S> two years<S>1333</S> Porcius<S>4201</S> Festus<S>5347</S> came<S>2983</S> into Felix'<S>5344</S> room<S>1240</S>: and<S>5037</S> Felix<S>5344</S>, willing<S>2309</S> to shew<S>2698</S> the Jews<S>2453</S> a pleasure<S>5485</S>, left<S>2641</S> Paul<S>3972</S> bound<S>1210</S>.
